page.title: 17Natural History of Brownsea
page.content: The north side of the island is a nature reserve managed by the National Trust. This is 240 acres of different types of habitat: pine forests where herons breed, two small lakes which attract ducks, fresh water reed marsh, salt water lagoon and beaches where oyster catchers nest. 117 different species of bird are seen on the island, 47 of which nest there. {In Spring and Summer:}Peacock, Pheasant,Heron, Shelduck, Little Grebe,Canada Goose, Oyster Catcher, Moorhen, Water Rails, Common Tern, Black-headed Gull, GreenWoodpecker, Sedge Warbler, Willow Warbler, Long-tailed Tit, Wren, Goldcrest, Reed Buntings, Woodcock, Nightjar, Great Spotted Woodpecker and Nightingale. The herony is the only large one left in Dorset.In{late Summer and Autumn} many types of waders and ducks appear.
